column2: The subject entity (nutrient/food/diet) is used to treat or manage the disease or condition specified by the object entity.
The subject entity (nutrient/food/diet) helps prevent or reduce the risk of the disease or condition specified by the object entity.
The subject entity (food/substance) worsens or increases the risk of the disease or condition specified by the object entity.
The subject entity (food/nutrient/diet) is recommended for patients with the disease or condition specified by the object entity.
The subject entity (food/nutrient/substance) is contraindicated or should be avoided by patients with the condition specified by the object entity.
Deficiency of the subject entity (nutrient) causes the disease or health condition specified by the object entity.
The subject entity (nutrient/food) enhances the absorption of the nutrient specified by the object entity.
Patients with the subject entity (disease) must restrict or limit the intake of the nutrient or food specified by the object entity.
Patients with the subject entity (disease) require supplementation or adequate intake of the nutrient specified by the object entity.
The subject entity (food/diet) contains the nutrient or compound specified by the object entity.
The subject entity (nutrient/food/diet) reduces the level or severity of the condition or biomarker specified by the object entity.
The subject entity (food/nutrient/habit) is associated with the increased or decreased risk of the condition specified by the object entity.
The subject entity (nutrient) has a recommended daily intake amount specified by the object entity.
The subject entity (nutrient) can be found in the food source specified by the object entity.
The subject entity (clinical sign or biomarker change) is a symptom or manifestation of the disease specified by the object entity.
